verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَا عَذَّبَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ قَوْماً قَطُّ وَ هُمْ يَأْكُلُونَ وَ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَكْرَمُ مِنْ أَنْ يَرْزُقَهُمْ شَيْئاً ثُمَّ يُعَذِّبَهُمْ عَلَيْهِ حَتَّى يَفْرُغُوا مِنْهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Fazal, from one of our companions, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has not Punished a people at all whilst they were eating, and that Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic is more Benevolent than that He<sup>azwj</sup> Sustains them with something, then He<sup>azwj</sup> Punishes them (whilst they are) upon it, (only after) they are free from it’.
